cyclone.name: MICHAEL
cyclone.current_location: about 455 miles south of Panama City, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing north-northwest through the east-central Gulf, then turning northeast across the Florida Panhandle on Wednesday and across Georgia and the Carolinas toward the Atlantic late Thursday-Friday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Panhandle/Big Bend coast near or east of Panama City, FL

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm Surge Watch and Tropical Storm Watch remain confined to Florida Gulf Coast and western Florida Peninsula
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane and Storm-Surge Warnings extend from the Alabama/Florida border to Suwannee River FL (Gulf side only)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeastern U.S. coastline from the Florida Panhandle through Georgia and the Carolinas
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (40–60 mph gusts) possible late Wednesday through early Thursday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge of 1–2 ft possible along the Georgia coast, but values above 3 ft are unlikely
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rainfall of 4–8 inches likely, with localized higher totals causing flash-flood risk
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes inland across southeast Georgia during Wednesday night–Thursday
